text.text: (Porto-Gonçalves, Carlos Walter, , pp. 39-43).

### Introduction

This section is intended to list the people who help maintain the project online, either through direct contributions or through projects with which we collaborate, directly or indirectly.

### Contributors

A space dedicated to recording the names of project contributors who wish to have their work explicitly acknowledged.

### Partnerships Work tends to develop more quickly and effectively as we find people who share values and complement one another with different kinds of knowledge. *History Tracers* has already collaborated with the following projects: - **Brazilian Founders**: founded by Damares de Andrade and Eduardo Santos Lima, dedicated to the study of the history and genetics of Brazilian historical figures (Brazilian Founders, Project). - **Roberto Moras**: We seek to contribute to the understanding and appreciation of the cultures, traditions, and histories of Indigenous peoples. We recognize that only through this dialogue between civilizations can we aspire to a better world, as well as access the knowledge of their pasts, which are an integral part of our national identities. We aim for these studies on traditions and sciences to be accessible to the entire population, since they are rarely addressed in schools. As part of this effort to spread knowledge, we collaborate with Roberto Moras creator of the YouTube channels America: Lo que no te contaron, Crónicas Prohibidas de América and Historia de las Religiones (Moras, Roberto. America: Lo que no te contaron ; Moras, Roberto. Crónicas Prohibidas de América ; Moras, Roberto. Historia de las Religiones).
